as you do…
 and you wouldn't believe it.

en: Daeth un o'r beasties ata i.

vi: It was a small one, and very cute, too.

en: Ac ie
roedd o jyst yn sterian arnaf i
tra o'n i'n trio cael twll trwodd.

en: -Ti'n iawn, Mic? -Yndw, Les.
-Ti'n siŵr bo chdi'n iawn? -Yndw.
Ti'm yn edrych yn rhy sbesial i fi. Cyma sip o ddŵr.
vi: You don't look too special. Take a sip of water.

en: Ti 'di cael pwl drwg arall do, Mic?
vi: You had another attack, didn't you?

en: Dw i'n iawn, Les, go iawn, rwan. Be och chdi'n deud, mêt?
vi: I'm OK, Les, really now. What were you saying, mate?

en: O, ia, 'fyd.
Fel o'n i'n tynnu serviette allan i sychu'r under carriage
vi: I took out a serviette to wipe my undercarriage…

en: -Serviette? -Ie, serviette.
Ges i llond pocad o'r Brigands Inn ddoe
vi: I helped myself in the Brigands Inn yesterday…

en: just in case bo fi isio emergency dump
vi: in case I needed an emergency dump in donkey and cart land.

en: i fyny yn y donkey and cart land 'ma.
-Dim dyna be 'dy'r point, naci. -Naci?
Wel naci, siŵr.
Ti jyst yn bod yn awkward.
Sori, Les. Caria 'mlaen, lyfli man.
vi: Sorry, Les. Carry on, lovely man.

en: Eniwe...
roedd y little one yn starian arnaf i, o'n i'n starian arno fo.
vi: the little one stared at me and I stared at him.

en: -Sut ti'n gwbod 'na ddim hi o'dd o? -Ti isio clywed y stori 'ma, ta be?
vi: -How do you know it wasn't a 'she'? -Do you want to hear the story?!

en: Sori. Caria 'mlaen.
It could have been a hogan buwch it could've been a hogyn buwch.
vi: It could have been a girl, it could have been a boy.

en: It doesn't matter for fuck's sake!
vi: -It doesn't matter for fuck's sake! -Sorry, sorry, sorry! Carry on.

en: Alright, sori! Caria 'mlaen wnei di.
Eniwe, fel o'n i'n sychu fy nhin efo serviette
vi: I wiped my arse with the serviette and pulled my trousers up.

en: ac yn codi fy nhrowsus i fyny, guessia be.
Be?
Doth y beasty bach i fyny ataf i a llyfu fy wyneb

en: efo'i dafod mawr pinc.
Y peth nesa

...big black massive thing it was anyway...
vi: a big black massive thing it was anyway…

en: ...ac o'dd y big beasty
vi: thought I was going to nick little beastie off him.

en: yn meddwl bod fi'n mynd i ddwyn y small beasty oddi wrtho fo.
Be ddigwyddodd?
I wasn't going to dwyn the little one from him was I, Michael?
vi: I wasn't going to nick the little one, was I, Michael?

en: - Dwn i'm, Les. - Well, of course not.
Eniwe, dynnais i fy flick knife allan

rhag ofn iddo fo kebabio fi efo'r horns massive 'na oedd ganddo fo.

en: Wedyn adawais i dros wal reit sharpish.

The wonders of nature, Michael.

Laddwn i am stecsan.
Tyrd. Allan o'r glaw 'ma, Mic.
July the 12th, 1973...

en: ...gath o ei eni.
A fe roioch chi e lan am adoption?

en: Roedd yn rhaid i mi, 'sti.
Y babi bach dela welais i erioed.

en: Beth am Les?
Pryd gafoch chi hwnnw?
Na, ffrind i mi gath Les

doedd hi'm yn medru copio, ti'n gwbod?

en: Achos bod fi'n difaru.

en: Ydy Les yn gwbod?
Dw i 'di trio explainio iddo fo.

No.
No.
Na, fi 'dy ei fam a'i dad o, medda fo. Love him, ie?

And there's only one Leswold Moore...

ar ôl yr handsome sailor

O, paid.

'Sdim llonydd i gael, nac oes, Chiefy Chief?

-Un del iawn 'dy o 'fyd, meddan nhw. - Piss off, Carbo.

en: Gad lonydd i fi.
Ga' i aros i fyny 'ma am ychydig, caf? Free country, yndy?

Dal am neud y job 'ma efo ni

Yli, falle mod i'n hen ac yn fusgrell

ond ar ôl colli eich mam a chithau yn ddim byd ond cywion...

Plîs, Mic. Plîs.

Hap a damwain ydy

Iechyd da!

en: Ie.
Ti'n iawn, I suppose.
'Na ti. Y garreg yn ôl.
Nawr dwed wrtha i
pryd mae gweddill y jewels yn debygol o adael Llundain i Holyhead?
vi: when are the rest of jewels likely to leave London for Holyhead?

en: Achos y munud geith y criw wybod, gorau'n byd
vi: The sooner the gang knows, the better.

en: a ga' innau gyfle i fynd i weld Ishmael, y torrwr
vi: I'll have the chance to see Ishmael the cutter to arrange the sale.

en: i drefnu'r gwerthiant.
Mewn tri diwrnod, o be dw i'n ddallt.
Felly dydd Llun mae D-Day.
No.
Lle chwech.
No, sorry. Never seen him before.
vi: No, no, sorry. I haven't seen him before.

en: No, definitely not.
Dw i'n mynd allan am bach o awyr iach.
vi: I'm going out for fresh air. Even prisoners do that.

en: Maen nhw'n cael gneud hynna yn jail hyd yn oed.
Stay put, Evel Knievel!
vi: Stay put, Evel Knievel. Dad wants a word.

en: - Ma' Dad isio gair efo chdi. -Blydi nora! Pum munud fydda i!
vi: Bloody Nora! I'll only be five minutes!

en: Helo, Bwlch 387.
Helo, Gronw.
Fi sy 'ma.
Gwranda, mae 'na ddau labwst newydd gerdded i mewn i'r Goat
vi: Listen, two thugs just walked into the Goat…

en: yn holi am ddau ddyn mewn BMW X6.
vi: asking after two men in a BMW X6,

en: Yr un un sydd ar dy fuarth di.
vi: like the one on your farmyard.

en: Mae 'na gar mawr du peryg yr olwg wrth y drws ffrynt.
vi: I bet it's their menacing looking black car that's parked outside.

en: Yn hwnnw maen nhw 'di landio, saff i ti.
Dw i wedi cofnodi y number plate.
-Ti isio fo? - Wel, ia.
Hwylus iawn, Gwilym.
Ia, aros di funud.
-Diolch yn fawr. - Aros funud, rwan.
Reit, dyma fo. Ti'n barod?
O for Oscar.
O for Oscar.
Y for Yankee.
Ie, Y for Yankee.
a'r numbers ydy five and eight.
vi:
and  numbers
 are five and eight.

en: Dewadd!
vi: Lucky I was in the Army

en: Lwcus bod fi 'di bod yn yr army ac yn dal i gofio'r phonetic alphabet.
vi: and I still remember the phonetic alphabet.

en: Argh!
Who the fuck are you giving my number plate to?
vi: Who the fuck are you giving my number plate to?
